And then, plastic recycling
has been an abject failure.
And that's not my opinion,
that's just what the numbers say.

So a new report by
Greenpeace found that only 5%
of plastic waste generated by Americans
was actually recycled last year.
According to this study,

US households generated 51
million tons of plastic waste

in 2021, and only 2.4 million
tons were actually recycled,
which is also a massive drop from 2014
when plastic recycling peaked at 10%.

But a key thing to take
away from this story

is that this isn't just
like about Americans

personally failing to
recycle their plastics,

systematic issues at basically
every step of the way.
